item.title: Monica add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Monica add a quote by Violet Haberdasher
item.description: "If you like nerds, raise your hand. If you don't, raise your standards." -- Violet Haberdasher

item.title: Monica add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Monica add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I've no time for broads who want to rule the world alone. Without men, who'd do up the zipper on the back of your dress? " -- Mae West

item.title: Monica add a quote by Alexander Hamilton
item.description: "Safety from external danger is the most powerful director of national conduct. Even the ardent love of liberty will, after a time, give way to its dictates. The violent destruction of life and property incident to war, the continual effort and alarm attendant on a state of continual danger, will compel nations the most attached to liberty to resort for repose and security to institutions which have a tendency to destroy their civil and political rights. To be more safe, they at length become willing to run the risk of being less free." -- Alexander Hamilton

item.title: Monica add a quote by Patti Smith
item.description:
"Please, no matter how we advance technologically, please don't abandon the book. There is nothing in our material world more beautiful than the book."
(Acceptance speech, <i>National Book Award 2010 (Nonfiction)</i>, November 17, 2010)" -- Patti Smith

item.title: Monica add a quote by Nadezhda Mandelstam
item.description: "I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity." -- Nadezhda Mandelstam
